Bills in Congress propose removing marijuana from Schedule I drugs, imposing a federal excise tax, and establishing a National Commission on Federal Marijuana Policy. The economic aspect of legalizing marijuana, specifically through imposing an excise tax, is a focal point of the debate. This report focuses on the economic debate over federal marijuana legalization, specifically on imposing an excise tax on legalized marijuana. It provides an overview of marijuana production, arguments for taxes, and analyzes possible tax designs.
